-- This script was generated by a beta version of the ERD tool in pgAdmin 4.
-- Please log an issue at https://redmine.postgresql.org/projects/pgadmin4/issues/new if you find any bugs, including reproduction steps.
BEGIN;


CREATE TABLE public.cities
(
    id integer NOT NULL,
    city_name character varying NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.employees
(
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    first_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    email character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.employers
(
    user_id bigint NOT NULL,
    company_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    web_site character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    telno character varying(255),
    website character varying(255),
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.job_postings
(
    id integer NOT NULL,
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    position_id integer NOT NULL,
    job_description character varying(1000) NOT NULL,
    city_id integer NOT NULL,
    salary_max integer,
    salary_min integer,
    open_position_qty integer NOT NULL,
    application_deadline date,
    job_posting_status boolean,
    job_post_date date,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.job_seekers
(
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    first_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    tcno character varying(11) NOT NULL,
    birth_date character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.positions
(
    id integer NOT NULL,
    position_name character varying(255),
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.users
(
    id integer NOT NULL,
    user_no character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    email character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    password character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    password_validate character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.validation_types
(
    id integer NOT NULL GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY ( INCREMENT 1 START 1 MINVALUE 1 MAXVALUE 2147483647 CACHE 1 ),
    validation_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.validations
(
    validation_id integer NOT NULL,
    validation_status boolean NOT NULL,
    validation_type smallint NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (validation_id)
);

ALTER TABLE public.employees
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (user_id)
    REFERENCES public.users (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.employers
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (user_id)
    REFERENCES public.users (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.job_postings
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (position_id)
    REFERENCES public.positions (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.job_postings
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (user_id)
    REFERENCES public.employers (user_id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.job_postings
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (city_id)
    REFERENCES public.cities (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.job_postings
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (user_id)
    REFERENCES public.users (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.job_seekers
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (user_id)
    REFERENCES public.users (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.validations
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (validation_type)
    REFERENCES public.validation_types (id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.validations
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (validation_id)
    REFERENCES public.users (id)
    NOT VALID;

END;
